item.title: Resonance Ionization Mass Spectrometry
item.description: This talk is geared heavily towards mass spectrometrists that are interested in resonance ionization mass spectrometry and want to know more on how it works. The science is kept to a minimum and the talk mainly focuses on the technical aspects.

item.title: New Opportunities with Stardust
item.description:
This brief presentation reviews some recent highlights of stardust research and how it can be used to better understand astrophysical processes such as the slow neutron capture process and the formation of proton- and neutron-rich nuclides. Finally, the presentation discusses future opportunities with stardust and how these measurements could help to further our knowledge of galactic chemical evolution.

The talk was presented at the virtual 2020 JINA Horizons Meeting. A link to the meeting website can be found here.

item.title: iniabu: Getting Solar System Abundances in Python
item.description: A brief presentation to discuss the current status of the iniabu package available on GitHub. Some short demonstrations are given. A more complete usage guide can be found here.
